intro: Fleischmannia mercedensis, commonly known as the Mercedensis fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and it produces edible berries that are often used in local cuisine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates.
